title: Using Chao's Estimator as a Stopping Criterion for Technology-Assisted Review
abstract: arXiv:2404.01176v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: Technology-Assisted Review (TAR) aims to reduce the human effort required for screening processes such as abstract screening for systematic literature reviews. Human reviewers label documents as relevant or irrelevant during this process, while the system incrementally updates a prediction model based on the reviewers' previous decisions. After each model update, the system proposes new documents it deems relevant, to prioritize relevant documentsover irrelevant ones. A stopping criterion is necessary to guide users in stopping the review process to minimize the number of missed relevant documents and the number of read irrelevant documents. In this paper, we propose and evaluate a new ensemble-based Active Learning strategy and a stopping criterion based on Chao's Population Size Estimator that estimates the prevalence of relevant documents in the dataset. translated_title: 使用Chao's估计器作为技术辅助审阅的停止准则
translated_abstract: arXiv:2404.01176v1 公告类型: 新内容 技术辅助审阅（TAR）旨在减少用于筛选过程（如系统文献综述的摘要筛选）所需的人力工作。在此过程中，人类审阅员标记文档为相关或不相关，而系统根据审阅员先前的决定逐步更新预测模型。在每次模型更新后，系统提出新的文档，认为这些文档是相关的，以优先考虑相关文档而不是不相关文档。需要一个停止准则来指导用户停止审阅过程，以最小化错过的相关文档数量和阅读的不相关文档数量。在本文中，我们提出并评估了一种基于集成的主动学习策略和一个基于Chao的种群大小估计器的停止准则，该准则估计数据集中相关文档的流行度。我们的模拟研究表明，该准则在几个数据集上表现良好。
tldr: 本文提出并评估了一种新的基于Chao's Population Size Estimator的停止准则，用于指导技术辅助审阅过程，以最小化错过的相关文档和阅读的不相关文档数量。
